cause.description:
Be proud of your heritage/beleifs. G-d has stayed in our hearts since He first created us.
Yehudi is derived from the name Judah. Judah was of The word "Jew" (in Hebrew it is Yehudi) which is derived from the name Judah. Judah was the ancestor of one of the tribes of Israel. Likewise, the word Judaism literally means Judah-ism, that is the religion of the Yehudim. Yet other souces say Yehudim means People of G-d, because the first three letters of Yehudah are the same as the first three letters of G-d's four-letter name.
Jew=People of G-d!!!
Be proud to be of the People of G-d!
-Séan Michael Freese (Abvot-Micael)
1. There is only one G-d. No other participated in the work of creation.
2. G-d is a unity. He is a single, whole, complete indivisible entity.
3. G-d is the Only One to whom we should offer praise. The Shema can also be translated as "The L-rd is our G-d, The L-rd alone," meaning that no other
cause.name: Jew Crew
